intro: Sparganophorus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy cyathium flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a distinctive waxy coating, while its flowers are clustered in small, spherical structures called cyathia. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant yellow flowers.
